page.title: 08Brenchley Church.
page.content: The Church of{"All Saints"}Brenchley has stood grandly at the centre of the village since{1233.}It is approached by an avenue of enormous{yew trees, that are nearly{400}years old.In front of these is an impressive{lychgate}and behind these rises the square{clock {tower}housing{8}resounding{bells.} Inside,{kneelers,}worked by local ladies,illustrate themes of religious, local and national interest. The{vicar}is aided in the{services by the verger, wardens, servers,choir and organist. On Sundays there is a {Sunday School}and{Junior Church. { }During the week a young people's group,study groups and{Mother's Union meetings take place. The church{witnesses}through it's worship and teaching,and through it's christening,confirmation,marriage and funeral services.
